intro: Bartsia alba, commonly known as white bartsia, is a flowering plant native to temperate regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, often with a slightly hairy texture. Bartsia alba is typically found in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and meadows.
